body:
I just did

```
pip uninstall ipython # repeat until no more IPython
easy_install --upgrade distribute pip
pip install ipython
```

in a Python 3.3 venv, and it worked just fine. Try updating pip?
That was distribute 0.6.40 and pip 1.3.1, for reference.

Yes, I have the same versions of those installed.

Well, pip had a `/private/var/folders/_l/9w7fw81x1j14yl1903gchtyr0000gn/T/pip-build-bfroehle/ipython` directory which contained the IPython source in some state in which it thought that 2to3 had already been run (but which it did not).  Deleting that directory (and hence forcing pip to start over from the beginning) caused it to work.  Go figure.  I can't figure out how to reproduce this from scratch, so I'll just close it.

It has to do with the fact that `build_lib` is `build/lib` on OS X when there is no extension code, but `build/lib.<platform>` on Linux. This means that any prior run (e.g. by 2.7) results in 2to3 being skipped by future runs if a clean is not done.  This is a general distutils problem, and I cannot understand how it doesn't affect linux, because build_lib is supposed to be build_purelib everywhere if there are no extension modules, but that doesn't seem to be the case, despite the fact that the code clearly states that it should be.

I'm getting the same error even after I remove the the `/private/var/folders/.../pip-build-amit/ipython`:


After deleting the $TMPDIR folders, I managed to install IPython3 running:

```
pip3 install --ignore-installed ipython
```

But now IPython2 will not install successfully (due to the print function's new syntax).

What finally **did** work was erasing $TMPDIR before each installation:

```
$ pip uninstall ipython
$ pip3 uninstall ipython

$ find $TMPDIR -iname *pip* -print0 | xargs -0 rm -rf
$ pip install --ignore-installed ipython

$ find $TMPDIR -iname *pip* -print0 | xargs -0 rm -rf
$ pip3 install --ignore-installed ipython
```
@amitkot -  see @minrk's explanation of what causes this bug. There's not a lot we can do about it until we stop using 2to3, which we do intend to do at some point.
